column4: I can't make fglrx work, did it like https://wiki.ubuntu.com/BinaryDriverHowto/ATI#head-5ead174a0b3294527486cd4d71ded66b40003f25 said, but fglrxinfo says I have Mesa ?
have you checked that the fglrx kernel module is loaded? 'lsmod | grep fglrx'
Right. 'sudo gedit /etc/modules' - add fglrx to that
, done, CTRL + ALT + backspace to restart X ?
That'll make sure it's loaded next reboot. To load it *this* time only, do: 'sudo modprobe fglrx' and hit Ctrl-Alt-Backspace to kill your X server - it may take a minute or so to reload.
, modproble gave me FATAL: Error inserting fglrx (/lib/modules/2.6.15-23-386/volatile/fglrx.ko): Operation not permitted
did you run it with sudo?
Yes, but it didn't ask password
Try: 'sudo -s' to get a root prompt, then modprobe fglrx
, got into root, but still giving same error
Okay. Try rebooting - it's just possible it's an ordering problem.
, thank you now fglrx is working :)
, but on this boot my network card wasn't active before I fiddled with it :(
